Impaired CK1 delta activity attenuates SV40 - induced cellular transformation in vitro and mouse mammary carcinogenesis in vivo.
Simian virus 40 ( SV40) is a powerful tool to study cellular transformation in vitro, as well as tumor development and progression in vivo.

Various cellular kinases, among them members of the CK1 family, play an important role in modulating the transforming activity of SV40, including the transforming activity of T - Ag, the major transforming protein of SV40, itself.
